intro: Crotalaria eckloniana, commonly known as the African blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
